sen.j: 斑鳩町（いかるがちょう）は、奈良県生駒郡の町。
sen.e: Ikaruga-cho is a town in Ikoma-gun, Nara Prefecture.
Ikaruga-cho is a town in Ikoma County, Nara Prefecture.
Ikaruga-cho is a town in Ikoma County, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 飛鳥時代に聖徳太子の手によって法隆寺が建立されたことなどでよく知られる、古い歴史を持つまちである。
sen.e: It is an ancient town, well known for the construction of Horyu-ji Temple by Prince Shotoku in the Asuka Period.
It is an ancient town, well known for the construction of Horyu-ji Temple by Prince Shotoku in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に修正
sen.e: It is an ancient town, well known for the construction of Horyu-ji Temple by Prince Shotoku in the Asuka period.

sen.j: 法隆寺のすぐ西に広がる西里の集落は、近世初期の日本で最も組織的な力をふるった大工棟梁・中井正清の育った集落でもある。
sen.e: The community of Nishisato that spreads westward from Horyu-ji Temple was created by Masakiyo NAKAI, the master builder who is renown for his leadership and unparalleled skills in construction in the early part of the pre-modern era (late 16th century - early 17th century).

The community of Nishisato that spreads westward from Horyu-ji Temple was created by Masakiyo NAKAI, the master builder renowned for his leadership and unparalleled skills in construction in the early part of the pre-modern era (late 16th century - early 17th century).
sen.cmt: who is renown for→renowned forに修正
sen.e: The community of Nishisato that spreads westward from Horyu-ji Temple was created by Masakiyo NAKAI, the master builder renowned for his leadership and unparalleled skills in construction in the early part of the pre-modern era (late 16th century - early 17th century).

sen.j: それ以外にも多くの古い町並みが存在するが、高度経済成長以降、大阪のベッドタウンとして都市化が進み、落ち着いた町並みも、もはや過去のものとなりつつある。
sen.e: Although there are many towns and streets that preserve the historic atmosphere, these areas urbanized rapidly during Japan's economic expansion period and turned into suburbs of Osaka City, making the quiet, traditional atmosphere is rapidly becoming a thing of the past.

Although there are many towns and streets that preserve the historic atmosphere, these areas urbanized rapidly during Japan's economic expansion period and turned into suburbs of Osaka, making the quiet, traditional atmosphere is rapidly becoming a thing of the past.

Although there are many towns and streets that preserve the historic atmosphere, these areas urbanized rapidly during Japan's economic expansion period and turned into suburbs of Osaka, making the quiet, traditional atmosphere is rapidly becoming a thing of the past.

sen.j: 南に大和川が流れ、北には法隆寺の裏山にあたる松尾山 (奈良県)を中心とした矢田丘陵を仰ぐ。
sen.e: Yamato-gawa River runs to its south, and the Yata-kyuryo Hills, of which Mt. Matsuo (Nara Prefecture) is located at the back of Horyu-ji Temple, are located in the north.
Yamato-gawa River runs to its south, and the Yata-kyuryo Hills, of which Mt. Matsuo (Nara Prefecture) is located at the back of Horyu-ji Temple, are located in the north.
Yamato-gawa River runs to its south, and the Yata-kyuryo Hills, of which Mt. Matsuo (Nara Prefecture) is located at the back of Horyu-ji Temple, are located in the north.

sen.j: 西部には在原業平の和歌で知られる紅葉の名所、竜田川が、東部には「富の小川」として詠われている富雄川が流れる。
sen.e: Tatsuta-gawa River, known for the beauty of its autumn foliage described in the "waka" poem by ARIWARA no Narihira, is located in the west, and Tomio-gawa River described in poetry as "Tomi no Ogawa" is in its east.

Tatsuta-gawa River, known for the beauty of its autumn foliage described in the "waka" poem by ARIWARA no Narihira, is located in the west, and Tomio-gawa River described in poetry as 'Tomi no Ogawa' is in its east.
sen.cmt: 一部シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: Tatsuta-gawa River, known for the beauty of its autumn foliage described in the "waka" poem by ARIWARA no Narihira, is located in the west, and Tomio-gawa River described in poetry as 'Tomi no Ogawa' is in its east.

sen.j: 古代の大和国平群郡夜麻（やま）郷、坂戸郷の地である。
sen.e: It is the location of Yama-go and Sakado-no-Go of Hegurino-kori, Yamato Province, of ancient times.
It is the location of Yama-go and Sakado-go of Heguri County, Yamato Province, of ancient times.
It is the location of Yama-go and Sakado-go of Heguri County, Yamato Province, of ancient times.

sen.j: 龍田川が大和川に合流する地点の北西にある神南備・三室山山頂に延喜式内・神岳（かみおか）神社が鎮座する。
sen.e: At the peaks of Mt.Kamunabi and Mt. Mimuro, located northeast of the confluence of Tatsuta gawa River and Yamato-gawa River are Engishikinaisha and Kamioka Shrine.
At the peak of Mt. Kannabi (or Mt. Mimuro), located northeast of the confluence of Tatsuta-gawa River and Yamato-gawa River is Engishikinaisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws) Kamioka-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 「神南備(かんなび)・三室山」→同一の山のため、At the peaks of Mt.Kamunabi and Mt. Mimuro→At the peak of Mt. Kannabi (or Mt. Mimuro)とし (参考: http://dictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/jn/42114/m0u/)、スペース追加、Tatsuta-gawa River、Kamioka-jinja Shrineとし、are→is、Engishikinaisha and→Engishikinaisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws)としました。
sen.e: At the peak of Mt. Kannabi (or Mt. Mimuro), located northeast of the confluence of Tatsuta-gawa River and Yamato-gawa River is Engishikinaisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws) Kamioka-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 近年、藤ノ木古墳の発掘でも有名になった。
sen.e: The town has become famous in recent years with the excavation of Fujinoki Tumulus.
The town has become famous in recent years with the excavation of Fujinoki-kofun Tumulus.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに基づき、Fujinoki-kofun Tumulusに修正
sen.e: The town has become famous in recent years with the excavation of Fujinoki-kofun Tumulus.

tit.j: 名所・旧跡・観光・祭事・催事
tit.e: Historic and tourist spots, festivals and special events
Historic and tourist spots, festivals and special events
Historic and tourist spots, festivals and special events

sen.cmt: Ancient burial mound も用語としてつかわれているようですが、ここでは "Tumulus" で統一しました。

原文にないためOtsuka削除、統一表記に修正
"Ancient burial mound" も用語としてつかわれているようですが、ここでは "Tumulus" で統一しました。

sen.j: 生駒郡の安堵町、三郷町、平群町と北葛城郡の王寺町、上牧町、河合町（西和７町）との合併が審議されていたが、斑鳩町・王寺町・平群町で実施された住民投票の結果、財務状況が良好である斑鳩・王寺両町で反対票が多数となり、両町が合併協議会を離脱。
sen.e: The merger of Ando-cho, Sango-cho and Heguri-cho of Ikoga-gun and Kita-katsuragi-gun's Oji-cho, Kanmaki town and Kawai-cho (the 7 Seiwa towns) was deliberated, but a referendum conducted in Ikaruga-cho, Oji-cho and Heguri-cho showed that the majority of Ikaruga and Oji citizens opposed the merger, resulting in the two towns withdrawing involvement.

The merger of Ando-cho, Sango-cho and Heguri-cho of Ikoma County and Kita-katsuragi County's Oji-cho, Kanmaki-cho and Kawai-cho (the seven Seiwa towns) was deliberated, but a referendum conducted in Ikaruga-cho, Oji-cho and Heguri-cho showed that the majority of Ikaruga and Oji citizens opposed the merger, resulting in the two towns withdrawing involvement.
sen.cmt: 7をスペルアウト、Ikoga-gun→Ikoma County、Kita-katsuragi-gun's→Kita-katsuragi County's、Kanmaki town→Kanmaki-choに修正
sen.e: The merger of Ando-cho, Sango-cho and Heguri-cho of Ikoma County and Kita-katsuragi County's Oji-cho, Kanmaki-cho and Kawai-cho (the seven Seiwa towns) was deliberated, but a referendum conducted in Ikaruga-cho, Oji-cho and Heguri-cho showed that the majority of Ikaruga and Oji citizens opposed the merger, resulting in the two towns withdrawing involvement.

sen.j: 協議会は解散され、合併は白紙となった。
sen.e: The deliberation committee was dissolved, and the merger proposal was scrapped.
The deliberation committee was dissolved, and the merger proposal was scrapped.
The deliberation committee was dissolved, and the merger proposal was scrapped.

sen.j: また、新しい市の名前の候補は、西和市、法隆寺市、聖徳太市などが候補に上がり、新市名「西和市」の決定まで行っていた。
sen.e: Regarding the name of the new city, the committee had considered Seiwa, Horyuji and Shotokutaishi as candidates and 'Seiwa' had been picked.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: Regarding the name of the new city, the committee had considered Seiwa, Horyuji and Shotokutaishi as candidates and 'Seiwa' had been picked.
